class.name: AABB
class.description: [AABB] consists of a position, a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for fast overlap tests. It uses floating-point coordinates. The 2D counterpart to [AABB] is [Rect2]. [b]Note:[/b] Unlike [Rect2], [AABB] does not have a variant that uses integer coordinates.

method.name: AABB
method.description: Constructs an [AABB] from a position and size.

method.name: abs
method.description: Returns an AABB with equivalent position and size, modified so that the most-negative corner is the origin and the size is positive.

method.name: encloses
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [AABB] completely encloses another one.

method.name: expand
method.description: Returns a copy of this [AABB] expanded to include a given point. [b]Example:[/b] [codeblock] # position (-3, 2, 0), size (1, 1, 1) var box = AABB(Vector3(-3, 2, 0), Vector3(1, 1, 1)) # position (-3, -1, 0), size (3, 4, 2), so we fit both the original AABB and Vector3(0, -1, 2) var box2 = box.expand(Vector3(0, -1, 2)) [/codeblock]

method.name: get_area
method.description: Returns the volume of the [AABB].

method.name: get_center
method.description: Returns the center of the [AABB], which is equal to [member position] + ([member size] / 2).

method.name: get_endpoint
method.description: Gets the position of the 8 endpoints of the [AABB] in space.

method.name: get_longest_axis
method.description: Returns the normalized longest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_longest_axis_index
method.description: Returns the index of the longest axis of the [AABB] (according to [Vector3]'s [code]AXIS_*[/code] constants).

method.name: get_longest_axis_size
method.description: Returns the scalar length of the longest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_shortest_axis
method.description: Returns the normalized shortest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_shortest_axis_index
method.description: Returns the index of the shortest axis of the [AABB] (according to [Vector3]::AXIS* enum).

method.name: get_shortest_axis_size
method.description: Returns the scalar length of the shortest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_support
method.description: Returns the support point in a given direction. This is useful for collision detection algorithms.

method.name: grow
method.description: Returns a copy of the [AABB] grown a given amount of units towards all the sides.

method.name: has_no_area
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] is flat or empty.

method.name: has_no_surface
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] is empty.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] contains a point.

method.name: intersection
method.description: Returns the intersection between two [AABB]. An empty AABB (size 0,0,0) is returned on failure.

method.name: intersects
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] overlaps with another.

method.name: intersects_plane
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] is on both sides of a plane.

method.name: intersects_segment
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AABB] intersects the line segment between [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code].

method.name: is_equal_approx
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [AABB] and [code]aabb[/code] are approximately equal, by calling [method @GDScript.is_equal_approx] on each component.

method.name: merge
method.description: Returns a larger [AABB] that contains both this [AABB] and [code]with[/code].

members.member: Ending corner. This is calculated as [code]position + size[/code]. Setting this value will change the size.
Beginning corner. Typically has values lower than [member end].
Size from [member position] to [member end]. Typically, all components are positive. If the size is negative, you can use [method abs] to fix it.
